item.title: EBike Menace - Carelessly Abandoned junction of Creek Road / Church Street, 23rd January
item.description:
Carelessly abandoned Forest eBike blocking narrow pavement... this Forest eBike has been deliberately abandoned to block a narrow Footpath... this Forest eBike is dangerously anti-social... please remove IMMEDIATELY... Forest bikes are an unacceptable menace on our Footpaths - this is not only selfish but also dangerous... Users must face the consequences of their selfish actions... I invite you, please, to issue your offending “Forest bike user” a final warning, or a £100 fine...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39 - 41, Greenwich Church Street, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long pot hole, 23rd January
item.description:
The area on the left of the road is appalling and all the gravels coming out a real hazard for cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, College Road, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Corner Hartland and Honiton, 23rd January
item.description:
Blue bags were removed but left a mess behind, including poo bags and food wrappers. Needs sweeping.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London

item.title: A wooden palette, 23rd January
item.description:
Wooden palette has been on grass verge for some time. Please can it be removed. If gardeners come to cut grass this verge will be missed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37 - 59, Barham Road, Chislehurst, Greater London

item.title: Outside 18 Hartland Road NW6, 23rd January
item.description:
Plane tree pruning was missed during recent pruning works. Badly in need of being cut back.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hartland Road, London

item.title: Alleyway block full of rubbish & overgrown weeds, 23rd January
item.description:
Resident reporting that she lives on the corner and next to an alleyway, in the alleyway there is a lot of bags of rubbish, foliage, overgrown weeds and bags of rubbish torn and it has been like this for a long time, before it was an active alleyway and now it has been blocked off and accumulated over the years. the alley way comes up along Falconwood avenue and it passes residents garage and she has no access to it. Please could someone look into clearing this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safe cycle and pedestrian access to Aden Terrace, 23rd January
item.description:
Pedestrians and cyclists need to share this bit of pavement to access Aden Terrace. This creates conflict with pedestrians and the council should look to improve this situation.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baring Road, Chinbrook, Greater London

item.title: Blocked drains / gullies all along Dudley Rd, 23rd January
item.description:
Every drain is blocked with leaves that are sitting in the kerbs of Dudley rd and Briarfield Ave. so when it rains heavily ( which it has been all week) the water can’t escape- therefore flooding the roads

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,3, Dudley Road, Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stembridge Road, Anerley, Greater London

item.title: Very large pothole, 23rd January
item.description:
There is a very large pothole going across the left hand lane in the direction of Elmer's end to birkbeck. It is right on the traffic lights on the entrance to the bus station. Impossible to avoid going into it when driving up Elmers end road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti tags on bins (council and private), 23rd January
item.description:
The same tags are appearing on all bins around Cleaver Square. Some bins are private but are very prominent on the streetscape and no doubt encourage perpetrators to graffiti elsewhere on council property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleaver Square, Kennington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roofers waste left, including food, 23rd January
item.description:
My neighbours employed JMC Roofing to fix a leak. The roofers, they left this waste in my garden almost 2 weeks ago and have not responded to calls to remove it. The waste includes food and I am worried about vermin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163, Dunstan's Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
